comments:
One of our users is getting the following exception. Can the SWT team comment on
this if the exception is correct, i.e. should be thrown on environments where
GDI+ is not available?

Adding Randy because this happend due to usage of the API through GEF/Draw2D.

Workaround: GDI+ can be downloaded from Microsoft.
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=6a63ab9c-df12-4d41-933c-be590feaa05a&DisplayLang=en
So the bug is that a required library is missing??

No, I'm just wondering why this exception is thrown on environments where GDI+
is not available. I thought SWT would silently ignore the call if advanced
painting isn't possible.

GDI+ is included with Windows XP, and I believe it was also made available to
Windows 2000 in an update, but I am not sure.

The exception is thrown so that the application can decide how to handle the
lack of GDI+.  I am sorry it caused you grief.  The exception also occurs under
UNIX if the cairo library is not available.

I do not think that silently ignoring the calls would be appropriate, as this
could lead to unexpected behaviour.  I should write a FAQ on this...

> GDI+ is included with Windows XP, and I believe it was also made available to
> Windows 2000 in an update, but I am not sure.

I seem to remember it being in SP3. Does anyone know for sure? I know it is in 
IE 6.0, Office, and other add ons.

traces.message: Unable to load graphics library [GDI+ is required] (java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError)
